name: Hardest Famous 1980s Quotes Trivia Quiz | Quotes | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Robin Leach.

	This is the introduction to "Lifestyles of the Rich and Famous."  This, of course, was a popular television series of the 1980's.

questions.text: "What a waste it is to lose one's mind, or not to have a mind."
questions.explanation:
Dan Quayle.

	Vice-President Dan Quayle became famous for messing up words and quotes in the late 1980's.  He made this flub when he was trying to recite the slogan from the United Negro College Fund, "A mind is a terrible thing to waste."

questions.text: "Ever dance with the devil in the pale moonlight?" This is a famous quote in which movie from 1989?
questions.explanation:
Batman.

	A very famous line made by the Joker (Jack Nicholson).

questions.text: "You're a murdering dog, Charlie.  You're a mass-murdering dog."
questions.explanation:
Geraldo Rivera.

	Geraldo Rivera hit the nail on the head with this quote in an interview with Charles Manson.

questions.text: "Bo Knows" is a popular phrase for which of the following advertising campaigns?
questions.explanation:
Nike.

	Of course this would be Bo Jackson who had a major endorsement deal with Nike that began in the 1980's.

questions.text: "I heard hard work never killed anyone but I figure, why take a chance."
questions.explanation:
Ronald Reagan.

	One more many quotable phrases from the President of the 80's.

Bartles and Jaymes.

	Famous ad tagline for alcoholic beverages.

Mr. T

	Mr. T was famous for his mohawk and tons of gold chains around his neck.  He also had some success in the 80's with "The A-Team" and an appearance in "Rocky III."

Ronald Reagan.

	Once again Ronald Reagan.

questions.text: "Where's the beef" was a popular slogan for which fast food restaurant?
questions.explanation:
Wendys & Wendy's.

	Clara Peller made this a popular quote in the 80's.
